verses.roman:
kahana nā yāya rāmānandera prabhāva
rāya-prasāde jāniluṅ vrajera 'śuddha' bhāva

synonyms: kahana nā yāya—cannot be described; rāmānandera prabhāva—the influence of Rāmānanda Rāya; rāya—of Rāmānanda Rāya; prasāde—by the mercy; jāniluṅ—I have understood; vrajera—of the inhabitants of Vraja; śuddha bhāva—unalloyed love.
translation: "It is impossible to describe the influence and knowledge of Rāmānanda Rāya, for only by his mercy have I understood the unalloyed love of the residents of Vṛndāvana.
